Futurewave’s trolley uses ai to navigate the golf course

Belgian strategic innovation agency Futurewave, in collaboration with Botronics software company, introduces iXi, the world’s first self-driving golf trolley. iXi mimics the role of a caddie, following players autonomously and positioning itself intelligently on the course. The trolley features a lightweight, foldable, and durable aluminum frame, and weighing just 10 kilograms, it can be easily transferred. Its advanced AI enables navigation while tracking real-time performance, analyzing the player’s movements, and offering insights and advice to help improve gameplay.


all images courtesy of Futurewave

ixi’s feedback improves golfer’s performance

The development of iXi took Futurewave product agency and Botronics two years of research and innovation.

The trolley features the patented iXi latch © 1-clic folding system, offering compact storage. By tracking key metrics like swing patterns and distances, the device provides personalized feedback, giving golfers the tools to ace their performance. In addition to its cutting-edge technology, iXi delivers a user-friendly design. The intuitive controls allow golfers to focus entirely on their game, while the trolley takes care of transporting their equipment. This hands-free operation brings a new level of convenience to the course, making it easier for players to concentrate on their technique without the distraction of handling their trolley.
